etymology.description: semantic: 日 ‘sun’ + semantic: 正 ‘upright; correct’.
etymology.interpretation: Combining the sun with the idea of uprightness evokes the sense of something plainly, correctly so—hence “right; indeed.” This evaluative meaning later generalized into the copular use “to be” and the affirmative particle sense.

examples.chinese: 是的，你说得对(是的，你說得對)。
examples.pinyin: Shì de, nǐ shuō de duì.
